course_title: Topics in Applied and Computational Mathematics

learning_outcomes.description: Explain how mathematical modelling and simulation can be applied to understanding phenomena in the natural sciences
Model problems with differential equations (ordinary, partial, stochastic) and obtain and interpret accurate numerical solutions to these problems
For a given phenomenon, explain how mathematical models on different levels of detail are related to each other through asymptotic expansion
Discuss and interpret the concept of emergent phenomena in physics and biology
Conceptualise and solve a scientific problem using the appropriate numerical techniques
Implement advanced numerical methods of solving partial differential equations, including finite element method, boundary element method
Evaluate and implement advanced agent/particle-based simulation techniques
Demonstrate written communication skills appropriate for scientific reports
